title: Potion card
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                                                       |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The card depicts a long-unvisited wine rack, with each bottle's label coated in dust. |

The potion card gives the effect of a potion to you and any allies in [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight").

The potion selected is determined as follows:

- Power level 0: Select a potion effect from this list:

  - [Potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing") (37.5%)
  - [Potion of agility](/Potion_of_agility "Potion of agility") (12.5%)
  - [Potion of brilliance](/Potion_of_brilliance "Potion of brilliance") (12.5%)
  - [Potion of might](/Potion_of_might "Potion of might") (12.5%)
  - [Potion of berserk rage](/Potion_of_berserk_rage "Potion of berserk rage") (12.5%)
  - [Potion of invisibility](/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") (12.5%)

* Power level 1: Two equally probable possibilities:

  - [potion of resistance](/Potion_of_resistance "Potion of resistance")
  - [potion of haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste")

- Power level 2: Two equally probable possibilities:

  - [potion of heal wounds](/Potion_of_heal_wounds "Potion of heal wounds")
  - [potion of magic](/Potion_of_magic "Potion of magic")

[Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados") blocks haste and berserk effects, wasting the card, but worshippers do not lose [piety](/Piety "Piety").

The Potion card could be found in the following [decks](/Decks "Decks") over the past several versions.

| [0.11](/0.11 "0.11")                                                                        | [0.12](/0.12 "0.12")                                                                        | [0.13](/0.13 "0.13")                                                                        | [0.14](/0.14 "0.14")                                                                        | [0.15](/0.15 "0.15")                                                                                                          | [0.16](/0.16 "0.16")                                                                                                          | [0.17](/0.17 "0.17")                                                                                                          | [0.18](/0.18 "0.18")                                                                                                          |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Wonders](/Deck_of_wonders "Deck of wonders") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Wonders](/Deck_of_wonders "Deck of wonders") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Wonders](/Deck_of_wonders "Deck of wonders") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Wonders](/Deck_of_wonders "Deck of wonders") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Defence](/Deck_of_defence "Deck of defence") [War](/Deck_of_war "Deck of war") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Defence](/Deck_of_defence "Deck of defence") [War](/Deck_of_war "Deck of war") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Defence](/Deck_of_defence "Deck of defence") [War](/Deck_of_war "Deck of war") | [Changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes") [Defence](/Deck_of_defence "Deck of defence") [War](/Deck_of_war "Deck of war") |

## History

- The Potion card was removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").
- Version [0.16](/0.16 "0.16") removed all strictly-negative effects and caused effects to be applied to allies when possible.

## See also

- [Cards](/Cards "Cards")
- [Decks](/Decks "Decks")

Potion card

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
The card depicts a long-unvisited wine rack, with each bottle's label coated in dust.

The potion card gives the effect of a potion to you and any allies in line of sight.

The potion selected is determined as follows:

  • Power level 0: Select a potion effect from this list:
    • Potion of curing (37.5%)
    • Potion of agility (12.5%)
    • Potion of brilliance (12.5%)
    • Potion of might (12.5%)
    • Potion of berserk rage (12.5%)
    • Potion of invisibility (12.5%)
  • Power level 1: Two equally probable possibilities:
    • potion of resistance
    • potion of haste
  • Power level 2: Two equally probable possibilities:
    • potion of heal wounds
    • potion of magic

Cheibriados blocks haste and berserk effects, wasting the card, but worshippers do not lose piety.

The Potion card could be found in the following decks over the past several versions.

0.11 0.12 0.13 0.14 0.15 0.16 0.17 0.18
